article_title: Should Iowa, New Hampshire get first say in presidential choice?
article_text:
Total Access

article_metadata.description: WASHINGTON — Consider a few numbers: Roughly twice as many people live in the Columbus area than voted in the 2008 Iowa Caucuses and New Hampshire primary. Then try these: A Des Moines Register/Bloomberg Poll this month shows that 43 percent of the Democrats planning to attend the Feb. 1 Iowa Caucuses call themselves socialists, while an NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll said 56 percent of people expecting to vote in the Feb. 9 New Hampshire Republican primary are conservative or very conservative.
